issue.title: Support Rails 7.1

labels.name: api-sync
labels.description: Things related with aligning APIs with external dependencies

labels.name: rails
labels.description: Stuff related to Ruby on Rails integration

repository.name: karafka
repository.description: Ruby and Rails efficient Kafka processing framework

issue.body:
This PR adds specs to ensure Karafka operates with Rails 7.1.

close https://github.com/karafka/karafka/issues/1655
ref https://github.com/rails/rails/issues/49494

body:
Ah yeah that's true, I realise this could have been clearer.

Feel free to assign me on the issue @rafaelfranca !

issue.title: Add doc to explain how to migrate to the new BroadcastLogger:
issue.body:
Add doc to explain how to migrate to the new BroadcastLogger:

- This should make it easier for apps or libraries that were previously relying on the private API. Also took the opportunity to tweak the doc of the BroadcastLogger to mention what happens when calling a non-standard method.

  Fix #49494

cc/ @mensfeld Hopefully this should make it clearer!

issue.title: Rails 7.1: Duplicate log events created per broadcasted logger

labels.name: rails
labels.description: Issues related to the Ruby on Rails framework

issue.body:
When using Rails 7.1 with the Ruby agent, ActiveSupport::Logger instrumentation no longer blocks broadcasted loggers from sending duplicate events. 

This issue seeks to resolve the duplication.

See: 
* https://github.com/rails/rails/issues/49494 
* https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/49518
